description: A Task represents a Python function that can be executed automatically in the background, using Redis Queue and workers.

fields.description: If the function requires arguments, enter them here as a Python Dictionary of key-values.
fields.label: Function Arguments

fields.description:
Task is immediately enqueued in a Redis Queue.
Note: Equivalent to calling 'frappe.enqueue' (does not use BTU Scheduler daemon)
fields.label: Run via RQ Worker

fields.description: Function will execute within a gunicorn web server thread.
fields.label: Run on Web Server

fields.description: The module path and function will be validated during Save.
fields.label: Path to Function or BTU-aware Class

fields.description:
This checkbox disables the "Run on Web Server" button.
Useful to protect accidentally running a lengthy process on the web server.
fields.label: Run only from Workers

fields.description: After this many seconds, Task Logs still "In-Progress" will be remarked as "Failed".  This may trigger an email (configurable per Schedule)
fields.label: Max Task Duration (secs)

fields.description: By default, all stdout is capture in the BTU Task Log.  When this box is marked, stdout will -also- get logged to stdout.
fields.label: Repeat log in stdout

fields.description: Transient Tasks are not reusable: they only execute once.  They are created automatically by BTU-aware classes.  Similar to using 'frappe.enqueue()'
fields.label: Transient

name: BTU Task
